intro: Calectasia obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved calectasia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Iridaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, delicate flowers that range in color from white to pink. Calectasia obtusa typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
